Key Match Events: Trae Young capped a 24-point, 20 assist game by hitting the game winning shot from halfcourt just seconds after Utah guard Collin Sexton tied the game with a three-pointer of his own.

The Hawks had seven players in double-figures tonight vs Utah, including Young. Zaccharie Risacher (14), Vit Krejci (13), Clint Capela (18), Dyson Daniels (16), Bogdan Bogdanovic (11), and De'Andre Hunter all got in double figures and picked up the scoring with Johnson out.

Utah got a great performance from star forward Lauri Markkanen tonight and it nearly got them the win. Markkanen scored 35 points on 8-15 shooting from three point range, but he did miss his last three attempts in the fourth quarter.
Sexton scored 24 points for the Jazz and it was also a nice night for Walker Kessler, who had 21 points, 10 rebounds, and three blocks.
After leading by 15, Atlanta only led 36-32 after the first quarter.
The Hawks raced out to start the second quarter on a 14-2 run and led 50-34 when Jazz head coach Will Hardy opted to take a timeout.
Utah fought all the way back and trailed by only three at the half 65-62.
With time winding down in the third, Atlanta had gone nearly four minutes without making a shot, but Young found Hunter for a three and he nailed it to give Atlanta a 93-89 lead.
After the two teams played it close for the first 8.5 minutes of the fourth, Utah finally got the lead back and led 112-110 with 3:32 remaining.
Bogdanovic hit a big shot to put Atlanta ahead 113-112.
Young hit a three on the other end to give the Hawks the lead yet again 116-114.
Kessler was fouled and went to the line with a chance to tie the game. He nailed them both and made it 116-116.
Hunter hit another three-pointer and led 119-116.
Sexton nailed a three with 2.8 seconds remaining to tie the game.
Atlanta got the ball quickly to Young and watched him make magic happen to give them the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Atlanta Hawks came into Utah on a three-game losing streak and were without their emerging star Jalen Johnson for the third time in the last four games.
The Hawks needed a win tonight on the road vs one of the NBA's worst teams (who were missing three key players).
Post-Match Reflections: While Utah might be one of the worst teams in the league, this is a big win for the Hawks.
They don't play particularly well without Johnson, but managed to steal the win anyway.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Freezing temperatures have been sweeping across the city of Atlanta this week.
Utah has one of the worst defenses in the NBA and is one of the most turnover prone teams in the league and it showed early on.
The Hawks finished the game shooting 48% from the field and 41% from three.
In the first half, Atlanta shot 49% from the field and 33% from three. They outscored Utah 36-14 in the paint.
Utah was shooting 42% from the field and 48% from three.
In the third, Atlanta shot 38% from the field and 33% from three, while Utah shot 33% from the field and 29% from three.
After only turning the ball over twice in the first half, the Hawks turned it over six times in the third quarter alone.
